articles.summary: A US lawmaker is planning to propose legislation to track the location of artificial intelligence (AI) chips, including those made by Nvidia, after they are sold. This effort aims to address reports of widespread smuggling of Nvidia's chips into China, which violates US export control laws.

articles.title: OpenAI reverses course and says non-profit arm will retain control of firm
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: OpenAI has reversed course in the process of transforming into a for-profit entity. Its non-profit arm will continue to control the business that makes ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence products. Previously, the company had sought more independence for the division. It made the decision after hearing from civic leaders and having discussions with the Attorneys General of California and Delaware.

articles.title: OpenAI scraps controversial plan to become for-profit after mounting pressure
articles.author: Ars Technica

articles.title: Trump signs education orders, including overhaul of college accreditations
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed a series of education-focused executive orders recently. They are related to accreditation in higher education, school discipline policies, historically Black colleges and universities, artificial intelligence in education and workforce development. Last month, Trump called on U.S. Education Secretary Linda McMahon to 'take all necessary steps to facilitate the closure of her own agency.
